question: Is <image 1> Hamiltonian?
description:
The image depicts a graph consisting of six vertices (represented by circles) connected by edges (represented by lines). The vertices are arranged in a hexagonal pattern with an additional vertex placed at the center. Each vertex on the perimeter of the hexagon is connected to two adjacent vertices on the perimeter and also to the central vertex. The central vertex is connected to all six perimeter vertices. 

To summarize:
- There are seven vertices in total: one central vertex and six perimeter vertices.
- Each perimeter vertex is connected to two adjacent perimeter vertices and the central vertex.
- The central vertex is connected to all six perimeter vertices.
- The graph forms a structure where each vertex has a degree of three (three edges connected to it).

This detailed description should allow someone to determine whether the graph is Hamiltonian or not.
